DeleteAlarms.documentation: Deletes all specified alarms. In the event of an error, no alarms are deleted.

DescribeAlarmHistory.documentation: Retrieves history for the specified alarm. Filter alarms by date range or item type. If an alarm name is not specified, Amazon CloudWatch returns histories for all of the owner's alarms.

DescribeAlarms.documentation: Retrieves alarms with the specified names. If no name is specified, all alarms for the user are returned. Alarms can be retrieved by using only a prefix for the alarm name, the alarm state, or a prefix for any action.

DescribeAlarmsForMetric.documentation: Retrieves all alarms for a single metric. Specify a statistic, period, or unit to filter the set of alarms further.

DisableAlarmActions.documentation: Disables actions for the specified alarms. When an alarm's actions are disabled the alarm's state may change, but none of the alarm's actions will execute.

EnableAlarmActions.documentation: Enables actions for the specified alarms.

GetMetricStatistics.documentation:
Gets statistics for the specified metric.

The maximum number of data points returned from a single GetMetricStatistics request is 1,440, wereas the maximum number of data points that can be queried is 50,850. If you make a request that generates more than 1,440 data points, Amazon CloudWatch returns an error. In such a case, you can alter the request by narrowing the specified time range or increasing the specified period. Alternatively, you can make multiple requests across adjacent time ranges.

Amazon CloudWatch aggregates data points based on the length of the period that you specify. For example, if you request statistics with a one-minute granularity, Amazon CloudWatch aggregates data points with time stamps that fall within the same one-minute period. In such a case, the data points queried can greatly outnumber the data points returned.

The following examples show various statistics allowed by the data point query maximum of 50,850 when you call GetMetricStatistics on Amazon EC2 instances with detailed (one-minute) monitoring enabled:

  • Statistics for up to 400 instances for a span of one hour
  • Statistics for up to 35 instances over a span of 24 hours
  • Statistics for up to 2 instances over a span of 2 weeks

For information about the namespace, metric names, and dimensions that other Amazon Web Services products use to send metrics to Cloudwatch, go to Amazon CloudWatch Metrics, Namespaces, and Dimensions Reference in the Amazon CloudWatch Developer Guide.

ListMetrics.documentation: Returns a list of valid metrics stored for the AWS account owner. Returned metrics can be used with GetMetricStatistics to obtain statistical data for a given metric.

PutMetricAlarm.documentation:
Creates or updates an alarm and associates it with the specified Amazon CloudWatch metric. Optionally, this operation can associate one or more Amazon Simple Notification Service resources with the alarm.

When this operation creates an alarm, the alarm state is immediately set to INSUFFICIENT_DATA. The alarm is evaluated and its StateValue is set appropriately. Any actions associated with the StateValue is then executed.

PutMetricData.documentation:
Publishes metric data points to Amazon CloudWatch. Amazon Cloudwatch associates the data points with the specified metric. If the specified metric does not exist, Amazon CloudWatch creates the metric. It can take up to fifteen minutes for a new metric to appear in calls to the ListMetrics action.

The size of a PutMetricData request is limited to 8 KB for HTTP GET requests and 40 KB for HTTP POST requests.

Although the Value parameter accepts numbers of type Double, Amazon CloudWatch truncates values with very large exponents. Values with base-10 exponents greater than 126 (1 x 10^126) are truncated. Likewise, values with base-10 exponents less than -130 (1 x 10^-130) are also truncated.

Data that is timestamped 24 hours or more in the past may take in excess of 48 hours to become available from submission time using GetMetricStatistics.

SetAlarmState.documentation: Temporarily sets the state of an alarm. When the updated StateValue differs from the previous value, the action configured for the appropriate state is invoked. This is not a permanent change. The next periodic alarm check (in about a minute) will set the alarm to its actual state.

members.name: AlarmName
members.documentation: The descriptive name for the alarm.

members.name: Timestamp
members.documentation: The time stamp for the alarm history item. Amazon CloudWatch uses Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when returning time stamps, which do not accommodate seasonal adjustments such as daylight savings time. For more information, see Time stamps in the Amazon CloudWatch Developer Guide.

members.name: HistoryItemType
members.documentation: The type of alarm history item.

members.name: HistorySummary
members.documentation: A human-readable summary of the alarm history.

members.name: HistoryData
members.documentation: Machine-readable data about the alarm in JSON format.

members.name: Timestamp
members.documentation: The time stamp used for the datapoint. Amazon CloudWatch uses Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when returning time stamps, which do not accommodate seasonal adjustments such as daylight savings time. For more information, see Time stamps in the Amazon CloudWatch Developer Guide.

members.name: SampleCount
members.documentation: The number of metric values that contributed to the aggregate value of this datapoint.

members.name: Average
members.documentation: The average of metric values that correspond to the datapoint.

members.name: Sum
members.documentation: The sum of metric values used for the datapoint.

members.name: Minimum
members.documentation: The minimum metric value used for the datapoint.

members.name: Maximum
members.documentation: The maximum of the metric value used for the datapoint.

members.name: Unit
members.documentation: The standard unit used for the datapoint.

members.name: AlarmNames
members.documentation: A list of alarms to be deleted.

members.name: AlarmName
members.documentation: The name of the alarm.

members.name: HistoryItemType
members.documentation: The type of alarm histories to retrieve.

members.name: StartDate
members.documentation: The starting date to retrieve alarm history.

members.name: EndDate
members.documentation: The ending date to retrieve alarm history.

members.name: MaxRecords
members.documentation: The maximum number of alarm history records to retrieve.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: The token returned by a previous call to indicate that there is more data available.

members.name: AlarmHistoryItems
members.documentation: A list of alarm histories in JSON format.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: A string that marks the start of the next batch of returned results.

members.name: MetricName
members.documentation: The name of the metric.

members.name: Namespace
members.documentation: The namespace of the metric.

members.name: Statistic
members.documentation: The statistic for the metric.

members.name: Dimensions
members.documentation: The list of dimensions associated with the metric.

members.name: Period
members.documentation: The period in seconds over which the statistic is applied.

members.name: Unit
members.documentation: The unit for the metric.

members.name: MetricAlarms
members.documentation: A list of information for each alarm with the specified metric.

members.name: AlarmNames
members.documentation: A list of alarm names to retrieve information for.

members.name: AlarmNamePrefix
members.documentation: The alarm name prefix. AlarmNames cannot be specified if this parameter is specified.

members.name: StateValue
members.documentation: The state value to be used in matching alarms.

members.name: ActionPrefix
members.documentation: The action name prefix.

members.name: MaxRecords
members.documentation: The maximum number of alarm descriptions to retrieve.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: The token returned by a previous call to indicate that there is more data available.

members.name: MetricAlarms
members.documentation: A list of information for the specified alarms.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: A string that marks the start of the next batch of returned results.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: The name of the dimension.

members.name: Value
members.documentation: The value representing the dimension measurement

members.name: Name
members.documentation: The dimension name to be matched.

members.name: Value
members.documentation: The value of the dimension to be matched.

members.name: AlarmNames
members.documentation: The names of the alarms to disable actions for.

members.name: AlarmNames
members.documentation: The names of the alarms to enable actions for.

members.name: Namespace
members.documentation: The namespace of the metric, with or without spaces.

members.name: MetricName
members.documentation: The name of the metric, with or without spaces.

members.name: Dimensions
members.documentation: A list of dimensions describing qualities of the metric.

members.name: StartTime
members.documentation: The time stamp to use for determining the first datapoint to return. The value specified is inclusive; results include datapoints with the time stamp specified.

members.name: EndTime
members.documentation: The time stamp to use for determining the last datapoint to return. The value specified is exclusive; results will include datapoints up to the time stamp specified.

members.name: Period
members.documentation: The granularity, in seconds, of the returned datapoints. Period must be at least 60 seconds and must be a multiple of 60. The default value is 60.

members.name: Statistics
members.documentation:
The metric statistics to return. For information about specific statistics returned by GetMetricStatistics, go to Statistics in the Amazon CloudWatch Developer Guide.

Valid Values: Average | Sum | SampleCount | Maximum | Minimum

members.name: Unit
members.documentation: The unit for the metric.

members.name: Label
members.documentation: A label describing the specified metric.

members.name: Datapoints
members.documentation: The datapoints for the specified metric.

members.name: Namespace
members.documentation: The namespace to filter against.

members.name: MetricName
members.documentation: The name of the metric to filter against.

members.name: Dimensions
members.documentation: A list of dimensions to filter against.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: The token returned by a previous call to indicate that there is more data available.

members.name: Metrics
members.documentation: A list of metrics used to generate statistics for an AWS account.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: A string that marks the start of the next batch of returned results.

members.name: Namespace
members.documentation: The namespace of the metric.

members.name: MetricName
members.documentation: The name of the metric.

members.name: Dimensions
members.documentation: A list of dimensions associated with the metric.

members.name: AlarmName
members.documentation: The name of the alarm.

members.name: AlarmArn
members.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the alarm.

members.name: AlarmDescription
members.documentation: The description for the alarm.

members.name: AlarmConfigurationUpdatedTimestamp
members.documentation: The time stamp of the last update to the alarm configuration. Amazon CloudWatch uses Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when returning time stamps, which do not accommodate seasonal adjustments such as daylight savings time. For more information, see Time stamps in the Amazon CloudWatch Developer Guide.

members.name: ActionsEnabled
members.documentation: Indicates whether actions should be executed during any changes to the alarm's state.

members.name: OKActions
members.documentation: The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an OK state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number (ARN). Currently the only actions supported are publishing to an Amazon SNS topic and triggering an Auto Scaling policy.

members.name: AlarmActions
members.documentation: The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an ALARM state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number (ARN). Currently the only actions supported are publishing to an Amazon SNS topic and triggering an Auto Scaling policy.

members.name: InsufficientDataActions
members.documentation:
The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an INSUFFICIENT_DATA state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number (ARN). Currently the only actions supported are publishing to an Amazon SNS topic or triggering an Auto Scaling policy.

The current WSDL lists this attribute as UnknownActions.

members.name: StateValue
members.documentation: The state value for the alarm.

members.name: StateReason
members.documentation: A human-readable explanation for the alarm's state.

members.name: StateReasonData
members.documentation: An explanation for the alarm's state in machine-readable JSON format

members.name: StateUpdatedTimestamp
members.documentation: The time stamp of the last update to the alarm's state. Amazon CloudWatch uses Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when returning time stamps, which do not accommodate seasonal adjustments such as daylight savings time. For more information, see Time stamps in the Amazon CloudWatch Developer Guide.

members.name: MetricName
members.documentation: The name of the alarm's metric.

members.name: Namespace
members.documentation: The namespace of alarm's associated metric.

members.name: Statistic
members.documentation: The statistic to apply to the alarm's associated metric.

members.name: Dimensions
members.documentation: The list of dimensions associated with the alarm's associated metric.

members.name: Period
members.documentation: The period in seconds over which the statistic is applied.

members.name: Unit
members.documentation: The unit of the alarm's associated metric.

members.name: EvaluationPeriods
members.documentation: The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold.

members.name: Threshold
members.documentation: The value against which the specified statistic is compared.

members.name: ComparisonOperator
members.documentation: The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified Statistic and Threshold. The specified Statistic value is used as the first operand.

members.name: MetricName
members.documentation: The name of the metric.

members.name: Dimensions
members.documentation: A list of dimensions associated with the metric. Note, when using the Dimensions value in a query, you need to append .member.N to it (e.g., Dimensions.member.N).

members.name: Timestamp
members.documentation: The time stamp used for the metric. If not specified, the default value is set to the time the metric data was received. Amazon CloudWatch uses Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when returning time stamps, which do not accommodate seasonal adjustments such as daylight savings time. For more information, see Time stamps in the Amazon CloudWatch Developer Guide.

members.name: Value
members.documentation:
The value for the metric.

Although the Value parameter accepts numbers of type Double, Amazon CloudWatch truncates values with very large exponents. Values with base-10 exponents greater than 126 (1 x 10^126) are truncated. Likewise, values with base-10 exponents less than -130 (1 x 10^-130) are also truncated.

members.name: StatisticValues
members.documentation: A set of statistical values describing the metric.

members.name: Unit
members.documentation: The unit of the metric.

members.name: AlarmName
members.documentation: The descriptive name for the alarm. This name must be unique within the user's AWS account

members.name: AlarmDescription
members.documentation: The description for the alarm.

members.name: ActionsEnabled
members.documentation: Indicates whether or not actions should be executed during any changes to the alarm's state.

members.name: OKActions
members.documentation: The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an OK state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number (ARN). Currently the only action supported is publishing to an Amazon SNS topic or an Amazon Auto Scaling policy.

members.name: AlarmActions
members.documentation: The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an ALARM state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number (ARN). Currently the only action supported is publishing to an Amazon SNS topic or an Amazon Auto Scaling policy.

members.name: InsufficientDataActions
members.documentation: The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an INSUFFICIENT_DATA state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number (ARN). Currently the only action supported is publishing to an Amazon SNS topic or an Amazon Auto Scaling policy.

members.name: MetricName
members.documentation: The name for the alarm's associated metric.

members.name: Namespace
members.documentation: The namespace for the alarm's associated metric.

members.name: Statistic
members.documentation: The statistic to apply to the alarm's associated metric.

members.name: Dimensions
members.documentation: The dimensions for the alarm's associated metric.

members.name: Period
members.documentation: The period in seconds over which the specified statistic is applied.

members.name: Unit
members.documentation: The unit for the alarm's associated metric.

members.name: EvaluationPeriods
members.documentation: The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold.

members.name: Threshold
members.documentation: The value against which the specified statistic is compared.

members.name: ComparisonOperator
members.documentation: The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified Statistic and Threshold. The specified Statistic value is used as the first operand.

members.name: Namespace
members.documentation: The namespace for the metric data.

members.name: MetricData
members.documentation: A list of data describing the metric.

members.name: AlarmName
members.documentation: The descriptive name for the alarm. This name must be unique within the user's AWS account. The maximum length is 255 characters.

members.name: StateValue
members.documentation: The value of the state.

members.name: StateReason
members.documentation: The reason that this alarm is set to this specific state (in human-readable text format)

members.name: StateReasonData
members.documentation: The reason that this alarm is set to this specific state (in machine-readable JSON format)

members.name: SampleCount
members.documentation: The number of samples used for the statistic set.

members.name: Sum
members.documentation: The sum of values for the sample set.

members.name: Minimum
members.documentation: The minimum value of the sample set.

members.name: Maximum
members.documentation: The maximum value of the sample set.
